text: Mahdi Elmandjra (Arabic: مهدي المنجرة) (13 March 1933 - 13 June 2014) was a Moroccan futurist, economist, writer and sociologist. He was best known for his leadership roles with the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). Elmandjra was born in Rabat. He was educated in Morocco, the United States and the United Kingdom. Elmandjra died after a long illness on 13 June 2014 in Rabat, aged 81. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1933 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Moroccan academics Category:Economists Category:Sociologists Category:UNESCO Category:Moroccan writers
title: Mahdi Elmandjra
